title: Johnny Hammond Smith - 10 Albums - Jazz Organ
description:
Johnny Hammond Smith - 10 Albums

Johnny Hammond Smith (1933 – 1997) was an American soul jazz and hard bop organist.

I have only included albums where Johnny Hammond Smith plays the bass lines himself at the organ in this collection.

List of included albums in cronological recorded order:

1962 Johnny Hammond Smith with Seldon Powell - Look Out
1962 Johnny Hammond Smith with Willis Jackson - Cooks With Gator Tail
1962 Johnny Hammond Smith - Black Coffee
1963 Johnny Hammond Smith - Mr. Wonderful
1963 Johnny Hammond Smith - Open House
1963 Johnny Hammond Smith - A Little Taste
1965 Johnny Hammond Smith - The Stinger
1966 Johnny Hammond Smith - The Stinger Meets The Golden Thrush
1966 Johnny Hammond Smith - Love Potion No 9
1968 Johnny Hammond Smith - Nasty

MP3 format. All songs are tagged by the book.

Even though the liner notes states that Bob Cranshaw is playing the bass on the album Open House, that's not correct. Johnny Hammond Smith is providing the bass lines himself on Open House.

John Robert "Johnny Hammond" Smith (December 16, 1933 – June 4, 1997) was an American soul jazz and hard bop organist. Born in Louisville, Kentucky, he was a renowned player of the Hammond B-3 organ so earning "Hammond" as a nickname, which also avoided his being confused with jazz guitarist Johnny Smith.

--------

L Hammond, The Pirate Bay, where you'll find more jazz organ
